reviews.review_msg: Hes monotone and an incredibly boring lecturer. He took ages to give our papers back and the wording on the tests/quizes were super complicated. I URGE EVERYONE TO STAY AWAY FROM THIS PROF AND CLASS AT ALL COSTS. i am a poli sci major and enjoy the content but he made me dread the semester, and was not helpful when we asked him questions.

Scott is a very nice and helpful professor. However, his lectures are really boring as he talks all class long with a monotone voice. You can not really blame the guy though because the material is just boring. Make sure to participate in tutorials or you will get a basic score of 5/10. His exams are easy if you pay attention and attend tutorials.

Fantastic professor! I took a course with him online and he couldn't have been more helpful and kind. Responds to emails same day and with a thorough answer. Extremely knowledgeable and his feedback is useful/will make you a better writer/thinker. Fair marker. Would definitely recommend!
Great guy and very knowledgable. Lectures were a little boring but so was the course topic so it wasn't really his fault. Would take again no doubt.
Scott's tests were fair but be prepared to read the text, it is vital to doing well

Really nice guy, but if you can, avoid this prof.  Or don't go to class.  He's really knowledgeable on the topic, but really boring lecturer. Just read the textbook and the outlines he gives, and study your ass off.  His exams are fair enough, but I found the memorandum he assigned really difficult and not relevant.

Course itself easy, but oh god, avoid prof like the plague. He is a nice guy, but a terrible lecturer and teacher. Makes already dry material extremely dull, never looks up from note, speaks monotone all class. Cannot answer questions concisely and often leaves me more confused. I relied 100% on textbook and outline, stopped going to class.

He was an okay prof, took POL 222 and gave me quite a lot of tips. I did terribly on the midterm, so if you're not satisfied with a mark he gives you then go and talk to him and he can give you some really helpful advise. It helped me at least. Be sure e-mail him often if you don't get something as well, he's very willing to help.
hard exams which he doesn't prepare his students for at all and unfair marking

took over for Prof Erickson when she injured knee. did good job considering short notice.  did not teach, just read off his own notes. tests were fair and fairly marked. will improve as time moves on.
